company_description: Accenture plc is a leading global professional services company, headquartered in Dublin, specializing in strategy, consulting, technology, and operations services. It serves clients in more than 120 countries and employs over 700,000 people worldwide. The company helps businesses, governments, and organizations build digital capabilities and optimize operations through innovation and technology, including cloud, data, and AI solutions. Julie Sweet currently serves as the CEO, and Accenture is recognized for its strong industry expertise and global reach. Listed on the NYSE, Accenture reported $64.9 billion in revenue for 2024.

Adani Energy Solutions Limited (AESL) is India’s largest private power transmission and distribution company, headquartered in Ahmedabad. It operates a transmission network spanning over 26,600 circuit kilometers across 16 states, delivering reliable energy to millions. AESL also manages the distribution of power to over 12 million consumers, especially in Mumbai and the Mundra SEZ area. The company’s business extends to smart metering and large-scale cooling solutions for urban and industrial projects. AESL is a key proponent of green power, integrating advanced technology for innovative and sustainable energy delivery. Founded in 2013, AESL plays a transformative role in shaping India’s energy infrastructure.

Adani Enterprises Limited, the flagship company of the Adani Group, is an Indian multinational holding company headquartered in Ahmedabad. It operates as an incubator for emerging businesses in sectors such as mining, trading of coal and iron ore, airports, roads, water management, data centers, solar manufacturing, edible oils, and foods. The company is focused on creating new infrastructure businesses and has a diversified portfolio including energy, transportation, consumer goods, and primary industries. It has grown significantly since its inception and contributes to nation-building and value creation for stakeholders

Adani Green Energy Limited (AGEL) is India’s largest renewable energy company, developing, owning, and operating utility-scale solar, wind, and hybrid power plants. Headquartered in Ahmedabad, it is a part of the Adani Group and aims to reach 50GW of renewable capacity by 2030, supporting India’s green energy goals. AGEL currently operates over 10.9GW of renewable assets across 12 states, making it a leader in the sector. The company is globally recognized, including for large projects like the Kamuthi Solar Power Project. AGEL is committed to sustainability, with certifications for water positivity, zero waste-to-landfill, and minimal plastic use. The electricity generated serves both central and state government entities under long-term agreements.

Adani Ports & Special Economic Zone Limited (APSEZ) is India’s largest private port developer and operator, part of the Adani Group. Founded in 1998, it operates 14 strategically located ports along the Indian coastline, including Mundra Port, the country's largest commercial port. APSEZ’s business spans ports, integrated logistics, and Special Economic Zones (SEZs). It handles diverse cargo—containers, bulk, liquid, and automobiles—with an installed capacity of over 600MMT. The company is expanding globally, with assets in Israel, Sri Lanka, Australia, and Tanzania. APSEZ aims for 1 billion tonnes annual capacity by 2030 and continues making strategic acquisitions and infrastructure investments.

Adani Power distributes electricity primarily through its subsidiary Adani Energy Solutions Ltd (formerly Adani Transmission Ltd), which manages extensive transmission and distribution networks. It operates local power lines and transformers to ensure reliable power supply to homes, businesses, and factories, notably serving over 3 million customers in Mumbai alone. Adani handles billing, metering, and customer support as part of its distribution services. The company operates smart grids and invests in advanced technology to enhance efficiency and reliability of distribution. Its network covers key regions in India, with a major focus on Mumbai and parts of Gujarat. The company aims to be a benchmark in power distribution management and customer service across its operations

AWL Agri Business Ltd, formerly known as Adani Wilmar Limited, is one of India’s largest fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) companies specializing in essential kitchen commodities. The company offers a diverse product portfolio including edible oils, wheat flour, rice, pulses, sugar, and personal care products. It operates through multiple segments like Edible Oils, Food & FMCG, and Industry Essentials, serving both retail consumers and institutional clients. AWL's flagship brand, Fortune, is trusted by over 123 million households, reaching 1 in 3 Indian families, with a manufacturing footprint that includes over 70 plants and a wide distribution network. The company’s products also reach more than 50 countries internationally, positioning it as a key player in the food and FMCG sector globally

Adobe Inc. is a leading software company known for its creative and multimedia software products. Its flagship tools include Adobe Photoshop for image editing, Illustrator for vector graphics, and Acrobat for managing PDF files. Adobe offers these and many other apps through its Creative Cloud subscription platform, serving creatives and businesses globally. The company also provides digital marketing, document management, and AI-powered solutions to enhance productivity and creativity .

Ahluwalia Contracts (India) Limited (ACIL) is one of India's leading construction and infrastructure companies with over four decades of experience. The company specializes in civil construction, including commercial buildings, hotels, hospitals, educational institutions, industrial plants, and urban infrastructure projects. ACIL is certified with ISO 9001, ISO 14001, and OHSAS 18001 standards, reflecting its commitment to quality and safety. It offers integrated services such as design, civil construction, RMC, electromechanical works, plumbing, HVAC, and building facades .

Amazon is a multinational technology company founded in 1994 by Jeff Bezos, originally starting as an online bookstore. It has grown into the world's largest online retailer, offering a vast range of products and services globally. Amazon is a leader in cloud computing through Amazon Web Services (AWS) and also operates in digital streaming, smart devices, and grocery retail with Whole Foods. Known for its customer-centric approach, innovation, and vast logistics network, Amazon continues to be a dominant force in e-commerce and technology .

Apollo Hospitals Enterprise Limited, founded in 1983 by Dr. Prathap C. Reddy, is the largest private healthcare group in India headquartered in Chennai. It operates a network of over 70 hospitals across India and internationally, offering advanced medical care, telemedicine, diagnostics, and pharmacy services. The company is known for pioneering corporate healthcare in India and maintains high standards with international accreditations. Apollo Hospitals emphasizes quality, innovation, and compassionate care, impacting millions globally through accessible healthcare solutions .

Apple Inc. is an American multinational technology company founded in 1976 by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and Ronald Wayne in Cupertino, California. It designs, develops, and sells consumer electronics, software, and services, with iconic products like the iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple Watch. The company is renowned for its innovative design, industry-leading technology, and seamless integration of hardware and software. Apple has consistently been one of the largest publicly traded corporations globally, reaching a market capitalization of over $3 trillion in recent years. Its strong brand loyalty and visionary approach have revolutionized several industries, including personal computing and mobile technology.

Ashok Leyland Limited, founded in 1948 as Ashok Motors, is one of India's largest commercial vehicle manufacturers headquartered in Chennai. It became Ashok Leyland in 1955 after collaboration with British Leyland and is now part of the Hinduja Group. The company produces a wide range of trucks, buses, defense vehicles, and engines, with operations in over 50 countries. Ashok Leyland is the second-largest commercial vehicle manufacturer in India and a significant player globally .

Asian Paints, founded in 1942 in Mumbai by four friends, is India's largest paint company and a leading player in the global paint and coatings industry. It holds the position of the second-largest paint company in Asia and ranks eighth globally among coatings companies. The company operates in over 15 countries with 27 manufacturing facilities, serving customers in more than 60 countries. Besides paints, Asian Paints also offers products and solutions for home decor, including modular kitchens, bath fittings, and wall coverings .

Bajaj Auto Limited, established in 1945 by Jamnalal Bajaj, is one of the world's largest manufacturers of two-wheelers and three-wheelers, headquartered in Pune, India. It initially imported and sold two- and three-wheelers and later obtained a license to manufacture Vespa scooters under a partnership with Piaggio. Bajaj Auto is renowned for iconic products like the Bajaj Chetak scooter and the Pulsar motorcycle, contributing significantly to the Indian automotive industry. Today, it exports to over 70 countries and is the world's largest three-wheeler manufacturer and a major motorcycle exporter .

Bajaj Finance Limited, established in 1987 as Bajaj Auto Finance, is a leading non-banking financial company (NBFC) in India headquartered in Pune. It offers a diverse range of financial products including consumer loans, SME financing, commercial lending, and wealth management, serving over 100 million customers. The company has grown exponentially, with assets under management worth around ₹416,743 crore (US$49 billion) as of March 2025. Bajaj Finance is part of the Bajaj Finserv group and is recognized for its strong digital presence and innovation in financial services .

Bajaj Finserv Limited is a leading Indian financial services company and a core investment company under the Bajaj Group. It serves over 100 million customers with diversified financial solutions including lending, insurance, wealth management, and asset management. Key subsidiaries include Bajaj Finance (lending), Bajaj Allianz Life and General Insurance (protection), Bajaj Finserv Health, and Bajaj Finserv Direct, a digital marketplace. Bajaj Finserv emphasizes innovation, technology, and customer-centric solutions across both retail and SME segments .

Bajaj Holdings & Investment Limited (BHIL), formerly known as Bajaj Auto Limited, is an Indian investment company focused on holding strategic stakes in key Bajaj Group companies. It holds 33.43% in Bajaj Auto Ltd, 39.29% in Bajaj Finserv Ltd, and 51% in Maharashtra Scooters Ltd. BHIL emerged from the demerger of the erstwhile Bajaj Auto Ltd in 2007, which split the manufacturing and financial services businesses. The company primarily generates income through dividends, interest, and profits from investments, focusing on exploring new business opportunities .

Bandhan Bank, founded in 2015 and headquartered in Kolkata, is one of India's fastest-growing private sector banks focused on financial inclusion. It originated from a microfinance institution and became the first microfinance institution in India to be licensed as a universal bank. Bandhan Bank primarily serves underbanked and underserved segments, with 73% of its branches located in rural and semi-urban areas. As of June 2025, it operates over 6,300 branches across 35 states and union territories, serving more than 3.44 crore customers, with a strong focus on retail deposits and secured lending .

Bata India Limited, established in 1931, is the largest footwear retailer and manufacturer in India with a strong pan-India presence of over 1,950 stores. Known for quality, affordability, and diverse product offerings including formal, casual, sports shoes, and accessories, Bata has a legacy rooted in the Bata Shoe Company from the Czech Republic. The company operates multiple manufacturing units across India with a production capacity of over 46 million pairs annually. Bata India emphasizes innovation, sustainability, and digital transformation, with online sales contributing roughly 25% of its revenue as of 2024-25 .

Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) is a Navratna public sector undertaking under the Ministry of Defence, Government of India, established in 1954 and headquartered in Bengaluru. It is a premier Indian aerospace and defence electronics company specializing in the design, development, and manufacture of advanced electronic products for the Indian armed forces, including radar systems, communication equipment, electronic warfare systems, and avionics. Besides defence, BEL also caters to non-defence sectors like homeland security, smart cities, space electronics, renewable energy, and e-governance solutions. With a strong focus on innovation, quality, and self-reliance, BEL plays a significant role in India's defence ecosystem and technological advancements .

Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) is a major Indian public sector oil and gas company headquartered in Mumbai. It is the second-largest oil marketing company in India and also one of the country's leading integrated energy firms, engaged in refining crude oil and marketing petroleum products. BPCL operates refineries in Mumbai, Kochi, and Bina with a total refining capacity of about 35.3 million metric tonnes per annum. The company has an extensive marketing network consisting of over 23,500 fuel stations, more than 6,200 LPG distributorships, and is actively investing in renewable energy and sustainable fuel solutions as part of its growth strategy .

Bharti Airtel Limited is a leading global telecommunications company headquartered in New Delhi, India, with operations in 17 countries across Asia and Africa. It ranks among the top three mobile service providers worldwide, offering 2G, 3G, 4G, and 5G wireless services, high-speed home broadband, digital TV, and enterprise solutions. The company serves over 550 million customers and provides a diverse portfolio including digital payments, cloud, cybersecurity, IoT, and data center services. Bharti Airtel is a key player in India's telecom sector, known for its continuous network expansion, technological innovation, and strategic partnerships .

Biocon Limited, founded in 1978 by Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw and headquartered in Bengaluru, is India's largest biopharmaceutical company. It focuses on developing affordable biosimilars, novel biologics, and generic active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), serving customers in over 120 countries. Biocon's key therapeutic areas include diabetes, oncology, immunotherapy, and nephrology, with notable products like biosimilar insulins and monoclonal antibodies. The company also operates Syngene International, a contract research services subsidiary, enhancing its footprint in global life sciences research and development .

Blinkit, formerly known as Grofers, is an Indian quick-commerce company founded in 2013 and headquartered in Gurgaon. It operates a mobile app platform that allows customers to order groceries and essential items online, promising delivery within 10 minutes using a network of dark stores. Blinkit operates in over 30 cities across India and was acquired by Zomato Limited in 2022 for approximately $568 million. The company focuses on groceries, fresh produce, personal care, and other essentials, aiming to provide fast and convenient delivery services .

boAt Lifestyle, founded in 2016 by Aman Gupta and Sameer Mehta, is India's No.1 audio and wearable brand and the world's second-largest wearable brand as of 2022. Headquartered in Gurgaon, Haryana, boAt specializes in consumer electronics like wireless earphones, headphones, speakers, and lifestyle accessories, targeting millennials and Gen-Z with trendy, affordable, and durable products. The brand has grown rapidly through strong digital marketing, strategic partnerships, and channel expansion, including e-commerce and offline retail. boAt is also known for its community engagement, influencer collaborations, and focus on innovation in audio technology .

Britannia Industries Limited, founded in 1892 in Kolkata, is one of India's oldest and leading food companies specializing in biscuits, bread, cakes, rusk, and dairy products. Initially started by British businessmen, it transitioned to Indian ownership and expanded its product portfolio over the decades, introducing popular brands like Good Day, Tiger, and Marie. The company is part of the Wadia Group and has a strong market presence across India and internationally, with a focus on innovation, quality, and nutrition. Britannia continues to be a trusted household name, serving millions with a legacy of over 130 years .

Zydus Cadila, originally founded as Cadila Laboratories in 1952 by Ramanbhai B. Patel and Indravadan Modi, is a leading Indian multinational pharmaceutical company headquartered in Ahmedabad. In 1995, the company split into two entities: Cadila Healthcare (Zydus Cadila) and Cadila Pharmaceuticals, with Zydus focusing on pharmaceuticals, biosimilars, diagnostics, and skincare products. Zydus made history by launching the world's first adalimumab biosimilar in 2014 and developed India's first DNA-based COVID-19 vaccine, ZyCoV-D. The company is a significant player in global pharmaceutical markets with numerous FDA-approved products and a strong focus on innovation and research .

Canara Bank was founded by Shri Ammembal Subba Rao Pai, a visionary lawyer and philanthropist, in July 1906 in Mangaluru, Karnataka. The bank started as Canara Hindu Permanent Fund with a social mission to improve economic conditions and promote financial inclusion. It became one of the 14 banks nationalized by the Government of India on July 19, 1969, which significantly expanded its reach and services. Today, Canara Bank is one of India's largest public sector banks with over 9,800 branches and a customer base exceeding 11 crore, offering diverse banking services nationwide .

Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, technology services, and digital transformation, founded by Serge Kampf on October 1, 1967, in Grenoble, France. Originally named Sogeti, the company initially focused on IT and data processing services, later expanding through acquisitions including CAP and Gemini Computer Systems, resulting in the name Cap Gemini Sogeti. It simplified its name to Cap Gemini in 1996 and rebranded as Capgemini in 2000. Capgemini India was established in 2001 and has since grown to over 85,000 employees across multiple cities, serving clients worldwide with a comprehensive range of IT and consulting services .

Cipla Limited, established in 1935 by Khwaja Abdul Hamied in Mumbai as Chemical Industrial & Pharmaceutical Laboratories Ltd., is one of India's most prominent pharmaceutical companies. It played a key role in making healthcare affordable and accessible globally, notably developing a low-cost antiretroviral drug during the AIDS epidemic, which was widely used in poorer countries. Cipla has a broad product portfolio of over 1,500 medicines covering respiratory, APIs, and more, with a significant presence in India, Africa, and North America. The company has consistently focused on innovation, affordable medicine, and expanding global reach .

Coal India Limited (CIL) was established in November 1975 as a government-owned company and is now the world's largest coal producer. It came into being by merging various nationalized coal mines and authorities, including Bharat Coking Coal Limited (BCCL) and Coal Mines Authority Limited (CMAL). CIL operates 322 mines across eight Indian states, including 138 underground, 171 opencast, and 13 mixed mines. It plays a critical role in India's energy sector, supplying coal primarily to power plants, and has been recognized as a Maharatna company, giving it greater autonomy to expand operations. CIL also oversees a wide infrastructure including workshops, hospitals, and training institutes .

Cognizant Technology Solutions was founded in 1994 as an in-house technology unit of Dun & Bradstreet in Chennai, India. It became an independent company in 1996, focusing initially on Y2K projects and web development. Cognizant went public in 1998, raising capital through an IPO on NASDAQ. Over the years, it has grown into a global IT services and consulting leader, specializing in digital business, technology, and business process services. Key milestones include joining the Fortune 500 in 2011, acquiring TriZetto Corp in 2014 to expand healthcare IT capabilities, and focusing heavily on digital transformation, AI, cloud, and analytics services through 2024. The company employs over 340,000 people worldwide with an annual revenue approaching $20 billion .

Colgate-Palmolive India Limited was established in 1937 and is headquartered in Mumbai. It is a subsidiary of the global Colgate-Palmolive Company, which was originally founded in 1806 by William Colgate in New York City. The Indian arm started by marketing dental care products such as Colgate toothpaste, toothpowder, toothbrushes, and later expanded into personal care with brands like Palmolive Naturals. Over the decades, it has grown to become one of India's leading FMCG companies, with a wide presence in oral care, personal care, and home care products. The company has introduced popular products like Colgate Total, Colgate MaxFresh, and Palmolive Extra Care, continually focusing on innovation and quality .

Dabur India Limited was founded in 1884 by Dr. S.K. Burman in Kolkata as a small Ayurvedic medicine business. Originally focused on natural cures for ailments like cholera, constipation, and malaria, Dabur grew by blending traditional Ayurveda with scientific research. The company set up its first manufacturing plant in 1896 and established research laboratories by 1919 to ensure product quality and efficacy. Over time, Dabur diversified into various sectors including healthcare, personal care, foods, and home care, becoming one of India's largest FMCG companies with a strong global presence in over 120 countries. The company continues to emphasize innovation while honoring its Ayurvedic heritage .

DCW Ltd, formerly known as Dhrangadhra Chemical Works Limited, was incorporated in January 1939 when it took over India's first Soda Ash factories in Dhrangadhra, Gujarat, originally set up in 1925. The company has since evolved into one of India's fastest-growing chemical companies with a diversified product portfolio that includes commodity chemicals like soda ash, caustic soda, and specialty chemicals such as synthetic rutile, synthetic iron oxide pigments, and chlorinated polyvinyl chloride (C-PVC). DCW has expanded its manufacturing capacities and product range over the decades, operating multiple plants including a chlor-alkali plant in Tamil Nadu. The company remains focused on innovation, operational excellence, and sustainability while serving various industrial sectors in India and abroad .

Dell Inc. is an American multinational technology company founded in 1984 by Michael Dell, headquartered in Round Rock, Texas. It designs, develops, and manufactures personal computers (PCs), servers, data storage devices, network switches, software, and computer peripherals. Dell pioneered the direct-to-consumer sales model for custom-built PCs, enabling competitive pricing and strong customer support. The company expanded from hardware to IT services and enterprise solutions, notably acquiring EMC Corporation in 2015 to form Dell Technologies. Dell is one of the world's largest PC vendors and continues to innovate in computing, storage, and cloud infrastructure.

Dell Technologies Inc. is a leading American multinational technology company headquartered in Round Rock, Texas, formed in 2016 from the merger of Dell and EMC Corporation. It offers a wide range of products and services including personal computers, servers, storage, networking, and IT security solutions. In fiscal year 2025, Dell reported revenue of $95.6 billion, driven by growth in its Client Solutions and Infrastructure Solutions divisions. The company is a pioneer in AI infrastructure, cloud computing, and edge computing, targeting enterprise digital transformation. Dell is recognized for its strong innovation, sustainability efforts, and leadership in shaping future technology .

Deloitte India traces its origins to the early 20th century with the establishment of prominent local accounting firms like S.B. Billimoria & Co. (1902) and A.F. Ferguson & Co. (1893) in Bombay (now Mumbai). These firms later became part of the global Deloitte network through mergers and affiliations. Deloitte officially started its presence in India as Deloitte Haskins & Sells in 1976 through the member firm A.F. Ferguson & Co. The firm further expanded with affiliations to other legacy firms and eventually consolidated under the global Deloitte brand in 2003. Today, Deloitte India is a leading professional services firm with offices across multiple cities and approximately 15,000 employees, offering services in audit, consulting, tax, and technology advisory .

Divi's Laboratories Limited was founded in 1990 by Dr. Murali Krishna Prasad Divi in Hyderabad, India. Initially established as Divi's Research Centre, the company concentrated on developing commercial processes for manufacturing active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs) and intermediates. It was renamed Divi's Laboratories Limited in 1994 to signal its focus on API manufacturing. The first manufacturing facility was set up in 1995 in Choutuppal, Telangana, followed by a second facility near Visakhapatnam in 2002. Divi's Laboratories went public in 2003 and subsequently expanded its R&D capabilities with a research center in Hyderabad established in 2010. Over the years, it has grown to become one of India's leading pharmaceutical API manufacturers with global presence and consistently invests in innovation and quality .

Dr. Lal PathLabs was founded in 1949 by Dr. S.K. Lal, a pioneering pathologist trained at the Armed Forces Medical College in Pune and at Cook County Hospital in Chicago. Initially established as Central Clinical Laboratory and Blood Bank Transfusion Centre in Delhi, it was the first pathology lab of repute in Northern India. The company incorporated as Dr. Lal PathLabs Private Ltd. in 1995 and achieved key accreditations in the early 2000s, including NABL and CAP certifications. Over the decades, Dr. Lal PathLabs has expanded its network to over 200 laboratories and around 5,000 collection centers across India, becoming a leading diagnostics service provider known for its commitment to quality, innovation, and accessible healthcare. It was publicly listed following a successful IPO in December 2015 .

Dr. Reddy's Laboratories was founded in 1984 by Dr. Kallam Anji Reddy in Hyderabad, India. Starting as a manufacturer of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), the company quickly expanded into branded formulations and became one of India's leading pharmaceutical companies. Dr. Reddy's gained prominence with the launch of affordable medicines like the branded omeprazole 'Omez' and was the first Indian company to export pharmaceutical ingredients to Europe. The company has since evolved into a global pharma player specializing in generics, biosimilars, and proprietary products, with a presence in over 25 countries. Dr. Anji Reddy was also known for his philanthropic work through the Dr. Reddy’s Foundation established in 1996. The company is recognized for innovation, research, and its role in making healthcare affordable .

DXC Technology is a multinational IT services company founded on April 3, 2017, through the merger of Computer Sciences Corporation (CSC) and Hewlett Packard Enterprise's Enterprise Services division. Headquartered in Tysons, Virginia, USA, DXC provides end-to-end IT services, including cloud infrastructure, IT outsourcing, and digital transformation solutions for enterprise clients across various industries. The company has a significant global presence with over 125,000 employees worldwide, including more than 43,000 in India, and serves around 650 customers with a focus on mission-critical systems. DXC has continually evolved through restructuring, acquisitions like Luxoft, and divestitures, with a reported revenue of $13.7 billion in fiscal year 2024. It aims to deliver operational excellence and innovation, navigating complex digital transformations for its clients around the globe.

Eicher Motors Limited, headquartered in New Delhi, India, was founded in 1948 originally as the Goodearth Company to import and sell tractors. In 1958, it became Eicher Tractor Corporation of India Ltd., manufacturing tractors with technology from Germany. The company entered the commercial vehicle segment in the 1980s, and in 1993, Eicher acquired a majority stake (60%) in Enfield India Ltd., which manufactured Royal Enfield motorcycles. In 1994, Enfield India Ltd. was renamed Royal Enfield Motors Ltd. In 1996, Eicher Tractors Ltd. merged with Royal Enfield Motors to form Eicher Ltd. Royal Enfield dates back to 1901 in the UK but became part of Eicher's portfolio in India. Eicher Motors later divested its tractor business and now focuses on commercial vehicles and motorcycles, including the globally recognized Royal Enfield brand. Royal Enfield has expanded with new manufacturing facilities, international launches, and innovative motorcycle models like the Himalayan and the Continental GT 650 series .

Elgi Equipments Limited was founded in 1960 by L.G. Varadaraj in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, initially focusing on manufacturing air compressors and garage equipment. The company went public in 1975 and expanded its product portfolio to include advanced air compressors for industrial and automotive applications. Over the years, Elgi Equipments emerged as a global player with a presence in over 100 countries, launching several innovations like the world's smallest screw air compressor in 2002. It broadened its market reach through acquisitions such as Italy’s Rotair S.p.A. and US-based Patton's Inc. and established subsidiaries in countries like Australia, Thailand, and Indonesia. Elgi Equipments is recognized for its technological innovation, operational efficiency, and global expansion in the compressor industry .

Eli Lilly and Company, also known as Lilly, is a leading American multinational pharmaceutical company founded in 1876 and headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. It specializes in the development and manufacture of a broad range of medicines, including well-known drugs like Prozac, Cialis, and diabetes treatments such as Trulicity and Mounjaro. Lilly was the first company to mass-produce insulin and played a key role in the manufacturing of the polio vaccine. The company is recognized for its innovation in pharmaceuticals, focusing on areas such as diabetes care, oncology, neuroscience, and recently weight management. As of 2024, Lilly is one of the most valuable drug companies globally, with a strong commitment to research, patient outcomes, and expanding its global presence.

Emami Group was founded in 1974 by two childhood friends, Mr. Radhyeshyam Agarwal and Mr. Radhyeshyam Goenka, who left their corporate jobs with the Birla Group to start Kemco Chemicals, an Ayurvedic medicine and cosmetic manufacturing unit in Kolkata with a modest capital of Rs 20,000. Initially, Emami focused on personal care and Ayurvedic products, selling their items from a hand-pulled rickshaw. Early popular products included Emami Talcum Powder, Emami Vanishing Cream, Emami Cold Cream, and Himani Glycerine Soap. In 1978, Emami acquired Himani Limited, a century-old sick company, which became a turning point for the group. Over the years, Emami expanded its portfolio with flagship brands like BoroPlus antiseptic cream and Navratna, and acquired heritage Ayurvedic brands such as Zandu Pharmaceuticals in 2008 and Kesh King in 2015. Today, Emami is a leading FMCG company in India with a strong presence in over 60 countries and diverse business interests including beauty, healthcare, edible oil, real estate, and more .

Engineers India Limited (EIL) was incorporated on March 15, 1965, initially as a private limited company under an agreement between the Government of India and Bechtel International Corporation, USA. It became a wholly owned Government of India enterprise in May 1967. Headquartered in New Delhi, EIL specializes in engineering consultancy and project management services primarily for the oil and gas and petrochemical industries, and has diversified into sectors like infrastructure, water and wastewater management, fertilizers, solar, and nuclear power.EIL has successfully executed major projects such as India’s largest pipeline network (Hazira-Bijapur-Jagdishpur gas pipeline) and the Bombay High North offshore platform. It operates multiple offices across India and overseas, including in London, Milan, Shanghai, and Abu Dhabi. With over 2,300 engineers and professionals, EIL provides end-to-end services from design to commissioning with a focus on quality, safety, and sustainability. It was conferred Navratna status by the Government of India in 2014 and has a subsidiary, Certification Engineers International Limited (CEIL), as well as a joint venture Ramagundam Fertilizers and Chemicals Limited (RFCL). EIL remains a critical player in India's energy infrastructure development and has expanded its footprint internationally .

Ernst & Young (EY) is a global professional services firm formed in 1989 through the merger of Ernst & Whinney and Arthur Young & Co., with roots dating back to the early 1900s and even to 1849 via predecessor firms. EY offers a wide range of services including assurance (audit), consulting, tax, and transaction advisory to major corporations worldwide. The firm is known for its focus on professional development, early innovation in management consulting, and international expansion. EY is one of the 'Big Four' accounting firms and operates in more than 600 offices globally with a workforce exceeding 300,000 employees. The company’s mission centers around 'Building a better working world,' emphasizing trust, quality, and innovation in its client services.

Flipkart was founded in 2007 by IIT Delhi graduates Sachin Bansal and Binny Bansal. It started as an online bookstore operating out of a small apartment in Bengaluru. The company introduced innovations like Cash on Delivery to build customer trust and quickly expanded into electronics, fashion, and other categories. In 2018, Walmart acquired a 77% stake in Flipkart, fueling further growth. Today, Flipkart is one of India's largest e-commerce platforms with millions of users and a wide product range .

The FRND app is a social and chatting platform designed to help users connect with new friends through voice and video calls. It offers features such as simple signup with phone or email, anonymous chatting with avatars, and language-based matching for smooth communication. The app prioritizes privacy and safety, including strong measures for women’s safety and fake profile prevention. Users can join group chats, play games, and earn rewards while socializing. The app is popular for making online friendships and expanding social circles comfortably and securely .

Gabriel India Limited, founded in 1961, is a leading manufacturer of automotive ride control products such as shock absorbers, struts, and front forks. It operates multiple manufacturing facilities in India and serves major OEMs including Tata Motors, Mahindra & Mahindra, and Maruti Suzuki. The company also has a strong presence in the aftermarket segment and exports to several countries. Gabriel India has been investing in R&D and sustainability initiatives while expanding into electric vehicle components and the bicycle/e-bike segment. As of FY 2023, the company reported revenues exceeding ₹1,000 crore, maintaining a significant market share in the Indian automotive suspension market .

Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers Ltd (GRSE) is an Indian government-owned shipbuilding company, established in 1884 and headquartered in Kolkata. It specializes in building and repairing warships, patrol vessels, and commercial ships for the Indian Navy, Indian Coast Guard, and foreign customers. GRSE has built over 785 platforms including 108 warships and exports ships internationally. Apart from shipbuilding, GRSE also manufactures prefabricated steel bridges, deck machinery, and marine pumps. The company is recognized as a Miniratna public sector undertaking and is known for its innovation, quality, and contribution to India's maritime defense sector .

General Insurance Corporation of India (GIC) was incorporated on November 22, 1972, under the Companies Act, 1956, as a government-owned reinsurance company under the Ministry of Finance. It was formed as a result of the nationalization of the general insurance business in India through the General Insurance Business (Nationalisation) Act, 1972. GIC's primary role is to superintend, control, and carry on the general insurance business in India, excluding life insurance. It acts as the sole national reinsurer for Indian insurance companies and helps in promoting and supporting its subsidiaries. GIC has expanded its reach globally with offices in multiple countries and aims to be a leading global reinsurance and risk solutions provider .

Genpact is a global professional services company founded in 1997 as a business unit within General Electric (GE) in India, initially called GE Capital International Services (GECIS). It specializes in business process management, analytics, digital transformation, and AI-driven solutions, serving a broad range of industries worldwide. In 2005, Genpact became an independent company and was publicly listed on the New York Stock Exchange in 2007 under the symbol 'G'. The company has grown significantly, now employing over 125,000 people across more than 30 countries, with a 2024 revenue of approximately $4.77 billion. Genpact focuses on continuous innovation, combining Lean Six Sigma principles with advanced technology to help clients accelerate digital transformation and operational excellence.

Glenmark Pharmaceuticals Limited, founded in 1977 by Gracias Saldanha and headquartered in Mumbai, India, is a global research-led pharmaceutical company. The company focuses on developing advanced therapies in respiratory, dermatology, oncology, and specialty pharmaceuticals. Glenmark has a robust portfolio of over 320 branded generic products and a strong presence in emerging markets, along with a fast-growing generics business in the US. It operates multiple manufacturing facilities across continents and has several R&D centers dedicated to innovative drug discovery. Glenmark is known for its commitment to innovation, with a pipeline of novel molecules in clinical development, and partnerships to accelerate treatments for cancer and other diseases .

Godrej Consumer Products Limited (GCPL), part of the Godrej Group founded in 1897, is a leading Indian multinational consumer goods company headquartered in Mumbai. GCPL was established in 2001 after the demerger from Godrej Soaps Limited to focus on personal care, hair care, and home care products. Its popular brands include Cinthol, Good Knight, HIT, and Godrej No.1, serving consumers in over 85 countries. GCPL has expanded its global footprint through strategic acquisitions such as Darling Group in Africa and has a strong commitment to sustainability with initiatives like Godrej Good & Green. The company focuses on innovation, quality, and creating value for over 500 million consumers worldwide .

Google is an American multinational technology company founded on September 4, 1998, by Larry Page and Sergey Brin while they were Ph.D. students at Stanford University. Originally developed as a research project called 'BackRub' in 1996, it was renamed Google, a play on the term 'googol,'' representing the number 1 followed by 100 zeros, reflecting its mission to organize vast amounts of information. Google started in a garage in Menlo Park, California, with initial funding from angel investor Andy Bechtolsheim and has grown into a global leader in internet search, online advertising, cloud computing, software, and hardware. Key innovations from Google include its search engine, Google Ads, Google Maps, Google Chrome, Android OS, and YouTube acquisition, contributing to its status as a dominant tech giant. In 2015, Google restructured under the parent company Alphabet Inc. and continues to innovate with over 150,000 employees worldwide as of 2024.

Grasim Industries Limited, incorporated in 1947, is a flagship company of the Aditya Birla Group and started as a textile manufacturer in India. Over the decades, it has diversified into sectors including viscose staple fiber (VSF), chemicals, cement through its subsidiary UltraTech Cement, and financial services via Aditya Birla Capital. The company pioneered viscose staple fiber production in India and has grown to be a global leader in this segment. Grasim expanded its footprint by entering the cement sector in 1985 and becoming one of India’s largest cement producers. Today, it is a diversified conglomerate with a strong market presence and revenue exceeding ₹1.2 lakh crore (approx. $15 billion) as of 2023.

HCL Technologies, originally part of Hindustan Computers Limited (HCL), was founded in 1976 by Shiv Nadar and a team of engineers. Initially focused on manufacturing personal computers, HCL developed India's first indigenous 8-bit microcomputer in 1978, predating IBM's PC. In 1991, HCL Technologies was spun off as a separate software and IT services company, expanding rapidly into global markets, including IT infrastructure management and software services. The company has since grown into a major multinational IT consulting and services provider, operating in over 60 countries with more than 220,000 employees as of 2024. HCLTech has expanded through strategic acquisitions, including IBM software products and continues to focus on digital transformation, cloud, AI, and engineering services.

HDFC Bank was founded in 1994 as part of India’s financial liberalization when the Reserve Bank of India allowed private banks to operate. Its roots trace back to 1977 with the establishment of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC Ltd) by Hasmukhbhai Parekh, which was India’s first specialized mortgage company. The bank commenced operations in January 1995 with its first branch in Worli, Mumbai, and Aditya Puri as its first Managing Director and CEO who played a crucial role in shaping the bank’s growth. Over the years, HDFC Bank became India’s premier private sector bank, known for its strong focus on retail banking, digital innovation, and customer service. In 2022, HDFC Bank merged with HDFC Ltd, combining housing finance expertise with banking services, expanding its reach and products significantly.

HDFC Life Insurance Company Limited, founded in 2000, is one of India's leading life insurance providers, headquartered in Mumbai. It started as a joint venture between Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC Ltd) and Standard Life (now Abrdn), obtaining its certificate of commencement on October 12, 2000, and registration from the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) on October 23, 2000. The company offers a wide range of individual and group insurance products, including protection, pension, savings, investment, annuity, and health plans, with a portfolio of over 60 products. HDFC Bank became the promoter of HDFC Life on July 1, 2023, following the merger of HDFC Ltd with HDFC Bank, enhancing its market presence and distribution network. HDFC Life has a strong nationwide presence with over 498 branches and 300+ distribution partnerships, serving millions of customers mainly in India along with the GCC and MENA regions.

Hero MotoCorp Limited was founded in 1984 as Hero Honda Motors Limited, a joint venture between Hero Cycles of India and Honda of Japan. The company initially started manufacturing motorcycles in Dharuhera, Haryana, and quickly became one of the largest two-wheeler manufacturers in India, known for fuel-efficient models. In 2011, the joint venture ended when Honda sold its 26% stake to the Munjal family, and the company was renamed Hero MotoCorp Limited. Hero MotoCorp has expanded globally, exporting to Latin America, Africa, and West Asia, while also investing in electric vehicle technology through subsidiaries like Vida Electric Scooter. As of 2023, Hero MotoCorp reported a revenue of approximately ₹34,727 crore (around $4.3 billion) and remains a dominant player in the automotive two-wheeler industry.

Hindalco Industries Limited, founded in 1958 by Ghanshyam Das Birla, is an Indian multinational company and a flagship entity of the Aditya Birla Group, specializing in aluminum and copper production. The company inaugurated its first aluminum facility in Renukoot, Uttar Pradesh in 1962, marking a significant milestone in India's non-ferrous metals industry. Hindalco expanded over the years by acquiring Indian Aluminium Company (Indal) in 1989 and made a global leap with the acquisition of the US-based Novelis Inc. in 2007, becoming a major player in aluminum rolling and recycling. It also owns several captive power plants and mining assets, supporting large-scale production and sustainability efforts. As of 2023, Hindalco stands as one of the world's top five aluminum companies, with a diverse product portfolio and significant international presence.

Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) was incorporated on July 5, 1952, as the Standard Vacuum Refining Company of India Limited. It underwent several changes, including being renamed ESSO Standard Refining Company of India Limited in 1962, and later becoming Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited in 1974 following the amalgamation of Lube India and ESSO Standard Refining Company by a government order. The Government of India took over Caltex undertakings and merged them with HPCL in 1976 and merged Kosangas Company with HPCL in 1979, further expanding the corporation. Presently, HPCL is a Maharatna Central Public Sector Undertaking (CPSU) under the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, engaged in refining crude oil and marketing petroleum products across India and select foreign countries. Since 2018, the Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) holds the majority stake in HPCL following a government approval, solidifying its status as a key player in India's oil and gas sector.

Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) was originally established as Lever Brothers India Limited in 1933 by British entrepreneur William Hesketh Lever, making it one of the oldest consumer goods companies in India. It was formed through the merger of several Indian companies in 1956 under the name Hindustan Lever Limited (HLL). HUL introduced many household brands to India over the decades, including Lifebuoy, Lux, Surf Excel, and Fair & Lovely, becoming a pioneering force in the Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) sector. In 2007, it was rebranded as Hindustan Unilever Limited to align with its global parent company, Unilever PLC. Today, HUL is India’s leading FMCG company with a diverse product portfolio across personal care, home care, food, and beverages, and a strong commitment to social responsibility initiatives such as Project Shakti and Swachh Bharat.

Huhtamaki India was originally established in 1935 as The Paper Products Limited (PPL) in Lahore. After India’s partition in 1947, the company relocated its operations to India, becoming publicly listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange by 1950. Over the years, the company expanded its flexible packaging production with several modern plants across India, including facilities in Thane, Silvassa, Hyderabad, Rudrapur, and Sikkim. In 1999, The Paper Products Limited became part of Huhtamäki Oyj, a Finnish global packaging company. It was renamed Huhtamaki PPL Limited in 2014 and later rebranded as Huhtamaki India Limited, growing into a leading flexible packaging provider in India and globally.

ICICI Bank was established in 1994 as a wholly owned subsidiary of the Industrial Credit and Investment Corporation of India (ICICI), which itself was established in 1955 as a development financial institution to provide long-term project financing in India. ICICI was formed with support from the World Bank, the Government of India, and Indian industry representatives, initially focusing on financing large industrial projects. In 1998, ICICI Bank launched Internet banking, becoming one of the first major banks in India to do so. The bank expanded through acquisitions, including the Bank of Madura in 2001 and Sangli Bank in 1996, and merged with ICICI Limited in 2002, consolidating its operations into a universal banking entity. ICICI Bank is headquartered in Mumbai with its registered office in Vadodara and is one of India's largest private sector banks with a significant international presence.

ICICI Prudential Life Insurance Company Limited was established as a joint venture between ICICI Bank and Prudential Corporation Holdings Limited, a part of Prudential plc, on December 20, 2000. The company began operations in 2001, entering the Indian life insurance sector as one of the first private players to offer diverse life insurance and savings products. It quickly grew by launching innovative products such as unit-linked insurance plans (ULIPs) in 2002 and expanded its portfolio to include health insurance and retirement solutions. ICICI Prudential became the first life insurance company in India to be listed on stock exchanges (BSE and NSE) in 2016, highlighting its market leadership. As of 2025, the company reported assets under management exceeding ₹3 trillion, maintaining a top position in the Indian life insurance industry.

IDBI Bank, originally the Industrial Development Bank of India, was established in 1964 under an Act of Parliament as a wholly owned subsidiary of the Reserve Bank of India. In 1976, the ownership was transferred to the Government of India, and it became the principal financial institution for coordinating activities of institutions engaged in industrial financing and development. IDBI served as a Development Financial Institution (DFI) for 40 years before being transformed into a commercial bank in 2004 through the Industrial Development Bank (Transfer of Undertaking and Repeal) Act, 2003. The commercial banking division, IDBI Bank, was merged with the development finance institution in 2005. LIC currently holds a significant stake, managing the bank's operations alongside the Government of India. Today, IDBI Bank operates as one of India's major commercial banks with a wide branch network and extensive banking services.

IndiaMART was founded in 1996 by cousins Dinesh Agarwal and Brijesh Agarwal as India's largest online B2B marketplace connecting buyers and suppliers across various industries. Initially started as a directory to link Indian exporters with global buyers, it pivoted to focus on the domestic B2B market and expanded rapidly, incorporating digital payments and financing solutions to enhance business transactions. The company went public in July 2019 through an IPO, raising approximately ₹474 crore and becoming India’s first online B2B marketplace to be publicly listed. As of recent years, IndiaMART serves over 100 million registered buyers and 7 million suppliers, playing a key role in digitizing the SME sector in India. The platform continues to innovate with AI-driven tools that simplify procurement and supply chain management for businesses nationwide.

IndusInd Bank Limited was established in 1994, promoted by the Hinduja Group and inspired by the Indus Valley Civilization, symbolizing innovation and sound business practices. The bank commenced operations on April 2, 1994, with a vision to provide a diverse range of banking and financial services for individuals, corporations, and government entities. It became the first new-generation private sector bank in India to receive ISO 9001:2000 certification by 2000, reflecting its commitment to quality and customer service. IndusInd Bank expanded significantly over the years, including the launch of innovative banking products, acquisitions such as Deutsche Bank’s credit card business in India, and opening global representative offices in London, Dubai, and Abu Dhabi. As of 2025, the bank operates over 2,600 branches across India, serves over 37 million customers, and has earned accolades for its digital innovation and ESG initiatives.

Infosys was founded in 1981 by seven engineers, including N.R. Narayana Murthy, with an initial capital of just $250. The company was initially incorporated as Infosys Consultants Private Limited in Pune and later relocated its headquarters to Bangalore in 1983, which became a key hub for its growth. Infosys was a pioneer in the Indian IT industry and was the first Indian company to be listed on NASDAQ in 1999, marking its entry into the global market. Over the years, Infosys expanded its offerings from software development and consulting to include business process management and enterprise software products with subsidiaries like Infosys BPM and EdgeVerve Systems. Today, Infosys is a leading multinational IT services company with over 323,000 employees and operations in more than 50 countries.

Intel Corporation was founded on July 18, 1968, by semiconductor pioneers Gordon Moore and Robert Noyce, along with investor Arthur Rock. The company was initially incorporated as NM Electronics but soon changed its name to Intel, short for Integrated Electronics, after acquiring the rights from a hotel chain. Intel became a public company in 1971 and launched its first microprocessor, the Intel 4004, the same year, revolutionizing the semiconductor industry. Over the decades, Intel has remained a leader in semiconductor manufacturing, developing iconic products like the Pentium series and Core processors, and is known as one of the largest semiconductor chip manufacturers worldwide.Eli Lilly and Company, commonly known as Lilly, is a global pharmaceutical company established in 1876 and headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Lilly specializes in the development, manufacturing, and marketing of pharmaceutical products across various therapeutic areas, including diabetes, oncology, immunology, neuroscience, and more. The company is notable for pioneering mass production of insulin and developing important medications such as Prozac and Cialis. Lilly places a strong emphasis on innovation and research, driving advancements in medicine and healthcare worldwide.

ITC Limited, originally named the Imperial Tobacco Company of India Limited, was founded on August 24, 1910, in Kolkata during the British colonial era. It was established to manufacture and distribute tobacco products in India and initially operated as a Private Limited Company before becoming a public limited company in 1954. The company changed its name to India Tobacco Company Limited in 1970 and then to ITC Limited in 1974, reflecting a diversification beyond tobacco into other sectors such as fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), hotels, paperboards, packaging, agribusiness, and information technology. Today, ITC is one of India's largest conglomerates, with a significant presence in multiple industries and a global reach spanning over 90 countries.

Jindal Steel and Power Limited (JSPL) was founded in 1970 by Om Prakash Jindal in the Indian state of Haryana. The company initially began as a steel manufacturer and has grown into one of India's leading integrated steel producers with a significant presence in the steel, power, and mining sectors. JSPL launched its first integrated steel plant in Raigarh, Chhattisgarh, in 1995 with a capacity of about 3.6 million tons annually and entered the power sector in 1999 with a power plant in Chandrapur, Maharashtra. The company expanded internationally by acquiring coal mines in Mozambique in 2010 and inaugurated a new steel plant in Angul, Odisha, with a production capacity of 1.8 million tons per annum in 2016. As of the fiscal year ending March 2023, JSPL reported consolidated revenues of approximately ₹40,000 crores and remains a prominent player with a robust production capacity of 8.6 million tons of steel annually and a power generation capacity of 3,400 MW.

JM Financial was founded in 1973 by Mahendra Kampani and Nimesh Kampani as JM Financial & Investment Consultancy Services Pvt. Ltd. in Mumbai. Initially set up as a consultancy practice, it expanded into stockbroking in 1986 when JM Financial Share & Stock Brokers Limited was incorporated. The company was publicly listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange in 1991 and later on the National Stock Exchange of India in 2006. Over the years, JM Financial diversified into asset management, private equity, real estate investment, distressed credit, and mortgage lending, evolving into one of India’s prominent and diversified financial services groups. The group has continually pioneered several market innovations, including introducing convertible debentures and managing major capital market transactions.

JSW Infrastructure was founded in 1999 as part of the JSW Group, a major Indian multinational conglomerate with diverse interests in steel, energy, infrastructure, cement, and more. The company specializes in developing, operating, and maintaining world-class infrastructure facilities, including airports, shipyards, townships, roads, rail connectivity, inland waterways, water treatment plants, and special economic zones. JSW Infrastructure operates environment-friendly seaports and terminals, primarily located in Maharashtra and Goa, offering mechanized and multi-cargo handling facilities connected with industrial hinterlands. It is the second-largest private port operator in India, with significant cargo handling capacity and a strong focus on operational efficiency and sustainability. The company is headquartered in Mumbai and is a subsidiary of the Sajjan Jindal Family Trust.

JSW Steel Limited is a leading Indian multinational steel producer and the flagship company of the JSW Group. It was formed in 2005 through the merger of Jindal Iron & Steel Company and Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited. The company operates one of the largest steel plants in India, with an installed capacity of approximately 35.7 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) as of 2025, with plans to increase to 38.5 MTPA. JSW Steel is known for its broad product portfolio, including flat and long steel products used in industries such as construction, automobiles, and appliances. The company is also a pioneer in sustainability, aiming to produce green steel with hydrogen technology and holds numerous global sustainability awards .

KPIT Technologies is an Indian multinational company specializing in engineering research and development (ER&D) services primarily for the automotive industry. Founded in 1990 by Ravi Pandit and Kishor Patil, KPIT is headquartered in Pune, India, with development centers across Europe, the USA, Japan, China, and Thailand. The company focuses on software development for automotive mobility, including embedded software, AI, and digital solutions for smart, clean, and safe vehicle technologies. KPIT supports leading automotive OEMs globally in advancing next-generation mobility technologies such as autonomous driving, electric powertrains, and connected vehicles. As of 2025, KPIT employs over 13,000 professionals and is recognized for its innovation and specialized automotive engineering expertise .

Kotak Mahindra Bank Limited was established in 1985 initially as a non-banking finance company and became a full-fledged bank in February 2003 after receiving RBI approval. The bank offers diverse financial services including retail banking, corporate banking, investment banking, and wealth management. As of 2024, Kotak Mahindra Bank operates over 1,600 branches and more than 2,500 ATMs across India, serving over 40 million customers. In the fiscal year 2024, it reported a net profit of approximately INR 12,500 crores with strong growth in retail loan portfolios and digital banking initiatives. The bank is committed to innovation, customer focus, and responsible banking, aiming to be the most trusted and preferred bank in India.

Larsen & Toubro (L&T) is a premier Indian multinational conglomerate founded in 1938 by Danish engineers Henning Holck-Larsen and Søren Kristian Toubro. Headquartered in Mumbai, L&T operates across diverse sectors, including engineering, construction, manufacturing, technology, heavy industry, power, defense, and financial services. It is known for executing large-scale infrastructure and EPC projects both in India and internationally, with operations in over 50 countries. In fiscal year 2024-25, L&T reported consolidated sales of approximately ₹2.2 trillion and a net profit of around ₹150 billion, supported by strong growth in infrastructure and hydrocarbons segments. The company is committed to innovation, sustainability (targeting a 50% carbon footprint reduction by 2030), and expanding its global footprint, with a significant portion of revenue now coming from overseas operations.

Lenovo India, a subsidiary of global tech giant Lenovo Group, has significantly expanded its manufacturing footprint in India, doubling local production to over 12 million units of smartphones and laptops in the fiscal year 2024-25, compared to 6.4 million units in the previous year. The company operates a manufacturing plant in Puducherry for laptops, desktops, and AI servers, while contract manufacturers like Dixon Technologies produce Motorola smartphones, tablets, and laptops. Lenovo aims to achieve 100% local manufacturing of its PC models in India within the next three years and has already achieved 100% local production for its Motorola smartphones, which are also exported globally. Lenovo is investing heavily in AI research and development with plans for expanding R&D centers in India, including a new AI hub in Bengaluru. The company's revenue in India has grown substantially, with Lenovo India generating $2.5 billion year-to-date, reinforcing its strategic importance as a major manufacturing and export hub.

LG Electronics India Pvt. Ltd., a wholly owned subsidiary of LG Electronics, entered the Indian market in 1997 with its first manufacturing plant in Noida. In 2025, LG began construction of its third manufacturing plant in Sri City, Andhra Pradesh, with an investment of ₹5,001 crore (approximately $600 million). This new facility, spanning 247 acres, is expected to be operational by the end of 2026 and will produce 800,000 refrigerators, 850,000 washing machines, 1.5 million air conditioners, and 2 million air conditioner compressors annually. LG’s India plants in Noida, Pune, and Sri City combined will have an annual production capacity of millions of home appliances, solidifying LG's presence as a major player in India’s consumer electronics market. The new plant is aimed at serving domestic demand and exports to neighboring markets, while creating thousands of jobs and contributing to India’s electronics manufacturing ecosystem.

LG Soft India Pvt Ltd is the innovation and research & development arm of LG Electronics, headquartered in Bengaluru, India. Established in 1996, it is the largest global R&D center of LG Electronics outside of Korea. LG Soft India focuses on cutting-edge technologies including media solutions, home appliance and air solutions, vehicle solutions, webOS, and artificial intelligence, collaborating with leading global clients. The company is recognized for its strong commitment to innovation, quality, and excellence, driving advancements in smart home appliances, automotive infotainment systems, and AI-powered technologies. LG Soft India actively nurtures talent and encourages a people-friendly work culture, making it a vital hub for LG’s global product development and technology innovation.

Lloyds Metals & Energy Ltd (LMEL), incorporated in 1977 and headquartered in Mumbai, is a significant player in the Indian metals and mining industry. The company is engaged in iron ore mining, manufacturing of sponge iron (Direct Reduced Iron), and captive power generation. Lloyds Metals operates the largest iron ore mine in India located in Surjagarh, Gadchiroli, Maharashtra, with a capacity targeting 10 million tonnes per annum (MMTPA). It also has manufacturing plants in Ghughus and Konsari in Maharashtra, producing sponge iron and power with plans to expand into integrated steel production, including pellet plants, wire rod mills, and steel plants. The company prioritizes sustainability with initiatives such as slurry pipelines to reduce freight costs and emissions and the use of renewable energy and electric vehicles in operations. Lloyds Metals & Energy reported strong financial growth with 92% revenue growth in FY24 and is focused on expanding capacity with minimal debt leverage.

Lupin Limited is an Indian multinational pharmaceutical company headquartered in Mumbai, founded in 1968 by Dr. Desh Bandhu Gupta. It is a leading global player in generic drugs, biosimilars, and specialty pharmaceuticals, with a diverse portfolio covering therapeutic areas like pediatrics, cardiovascular, anti-infectives, diabetology, asthma, and tuberculosis. Lupin has a network of 15 manufacturing sites and 7 research centers worldwide, employing over 22,000 professionals. The company reported strong financial performance, with revenues of around USD 2.36 billion in FY24 and significant recent approvals from the US FDA for key drugs. Lupin is also committed to digital health, sustainability, and social responsibility through its Lupin Human Welfare & Research Foundation, impacting over 1.57 million lives across India.

Madras Fertilizers Limited (MFL) is an Indian public sector undertaking engaged in the manufacture of ammonia, urea, and complex fertilizers. Incorporated in December 1966 as a joint venture between the Government of India (holding 51%) and Amoco India, MFL is headquartered in Chennai. The company markets its products under the brand name VIJAY, including chemical fertilizers, bio-fertilizers, organic fertilizers, and neem-based pesticides. MFL operates through a network of dealers, co-operative marketing federations, and retail outlets primarily catering to agricultural needs, especially in South India where it holds a significant market share. It was the first public sector fertilizer company in India to receive ISO 9002 certification and actively contributes to sustainable agriculture with eco-friendly products.

Mahindra & Mahindra Limited, founded in 1945 and headquartered in Mumbai, is a flagship company of the Mahindra Group and one of India’s leading multinational conglomerates. It is a pioneer in the automotive and farm equipment sectors, being the world’s largest tractor manufacturer by volume and India’s top SUV maker by revenue market share. In the fiscal year 2024-25, Mahindra reported a consolidated revenue of ₹1,59,211 crore (about $19 billion) and a profit after tax of ₹12,929 crore, driven by strong demand for SUVs and tractors. The company is also expanding its portfolio in electric vehicles (EVs), with landmark launches like the BE 6 and XEV 9e electric SUVs, and holds leading market shares in light commercial vehicles and electric three-wheelers. Beyond automotive and farm sectors, Mahindra operates diversified businesses in financial services, technology, logistics, renewable energy, hospitality, and real estate, emphasizing sustainability and social impact across over 100 countries.

Manappuram Finance Limited is one of India's leading non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) specializing in gold loans. Founded in 1949 by V.C. Padmanabhan in Valapad, Kerala, it has grown rapidly and now operates over 5,000 branches across 28 states and union territories with assets under management (AUM) exceeding Rs 443 billion as of 2025. The company has diversified from its core gold loan business into microfinance, vehicle and housing finance, and SME lending, with non-gold businesses contributing nearly 43% of total business. Manappuram Finance emphasizes technology-driven operations and customer service, and it was the first Kerala-based NBFC to obtain the highest short-term credit rating of A1+ from ICRA. The company is led by Chairman and Managing Director V.P. Nandakumar, who has been instrumental in its remarkable growth and diversification.

Maruti Suzuki India Limited, established in 1981 as a joint venture between the Government of India and Suzuki Motor Corporation, Japan, is the largest automobile manufacturer in India. It specializes in small cars and has a strong market presence with popular models like Alto, Swift, Dzire, Vitara Brezza, and Baleno. As of the fiscal year 2023-24, Maruti Suzuki recorded revenues of ₹1.25 lakh crores and a net profit of ₹14,000 crores, with a market share of around 46% in the Indian passenger vehicle market. The company operates manufacturing facilities in Gurgaon and Manesar, Haryana, and has a state-of-the-art R&D center in Rohtak, Haryana. Maruti Suzuki continues to lead with a focus on innovation, sustainability, and customer-centricity while expanding its portfolio to include SUVs and electric vehicles.

Max Financial Services Limited (MFSL) is a prominent Indian financial services company primarily focused on the life insurance sector through its major subsidiary, Max Life Insurance Company Limited. Incorporated in 2016 following the demerger of Max India Limited, MFSL operates as a holding company managing investments and providing advisory services. Max Life Insurance is one of India's leading private life insurance companies, with a strong market share of approximately 9.5%, targeting to reach 10% by 2025. For the fiscal year 2022-23, Max Financial Services reported total income of ₹5,650 crore, a net profit of ₹670 crore, and demonstrated strong growth in new business premiums. The company is focused on digital expansion, distribution networks, and customer engagement through various channels including agency, bancassurance, direct sales, and digital platforms.

Max Healthcare Institute Limited is a leading Indian for-profit private hospital chain headquartered in Delhi, operating 22 hospitals with over 5,000 beds primarily across North India as of June 2025. It provides a wide range of healthcare services including multi-specialty hospitals, super-specialty hospitals, pathology, and home medical services. Founded in 2000, Max Healthcare has grown through strategic acquisitions such as BLK Hospital in Delhi and Nanavati Hospital in Mumbai, becoming the second-largest healthcare company in India by revenue. The company went public in August 2020 and is focused on expanding its footprint in super-specialty hospitals in larger cities. Recent acquisitions include Sahara Hospital in Lucknow and Jaypee Healthcare hospitals in Noida, Bulandshahr, and Anupshahr, with a strategic focus on enhancing specialty care services.

Meesho is a leading Indian social commerce platform founded in 2015 by Vidit Aatrey and Sanjeev Barnwal, headquartered in Bengaluru. By 2025, it has grown to over 140 million users and 15 million+ sellers, with more than 75% of its orders coming from Tier 2, Tier 3, and rural towns, reflecting deep penetration in non-metro Indian markets. Meesho offers a wide range of products across categories like women's fashion, home and kitchen essentials, beauty and personal care, men's and kids' apparel, quickly adapting to regional language content and cultural nuances for high engagement. The platform has a gross merchandise value (GMV) of about $6.5 billion and commands around 37% of the ecommerce market in volume terms, with a strong focus on affordability and value shopping. Meesho is on the path to profitability and preparing for a potential IPO, leveraging its asset-light logistics and extensive reach into India's underserved markets.

Meghmani Organics Limited, founded in 1986 and headquartered in Gujarat, is a leading Indian manufacturer of pigments and agrochemicals with six ISO-certified manufacturing facilities located in Gujarat's chemical belt. The company is one of the top three global players in phthalocyanine-based pigments and ranks among the top ten pesticide producers in India. Meghmani Organics offers a wide range of products, including green and blue pigments used in printing inks, plastics, paints, textiles, and rubber, as well as various pesticides for crop and non-crop applications. The company generates over 80% of its revenue from export markets spanning Africa, Brazil, Latin America, the US, and Europe, with significant demand from the US and Brazil. In FY25, Meghmani reported a 34% revenue growth and a 301% EBITDA growth year-over-year, driven by higher production and improved realizations, although it faces challenges like a low return on equity and considerable contingent liabilities.

Metropolis Healthcare Limited is India’s second-largest pathology chain with 124 labs and 2400+ collection centers.It recorded a revenue of ₹1,331 crore in FY25 with 12% year-over-year growth.Patient volumes and test volumes grew by 6% and 7% respectively in FY25.The company is expanding rapidly in tier-3 cities, contributing 18% of its revenue.It invests heavily in specialty diagnostics, AI-powered tools, and preventive health services, aiming for over 12% organic growth in FY26 .

Microsoft India and South Asia, under the leadership of Puneet Chandok, is focused on expanding AI and cloud investments, with a significant commitment by Microsoft to invest $3 billion over two years to accelerate AI and cloud infrastructure adoption in India. The company operates three data center regions in India and is launching a fourth by 2026, strengthening its cloud capacity. Microsoft India is driving a cultural transformation by embedding AI across businesses, supporting over 230,000 organizations using AI tools like Microsoft 365 Copilot. Despite global layoffs, India’s workforce is expanding with new roles created, especially in AI and cloud technologies, making India a key hub for Microsoft's future growth and innovation. The company is also actively collaborating with industries including BFSI, healthcare, and agriculture to revolutionize productivity and customer experiences with AI-enabled digital solutions.

Motherson Sumi Systems, now known as Samvardhana Motherson International Limited (SMIL), is a leading Indian multinational automotive components manufacturer headquartered in Noida. Founded in 1986 as a joint venture, it specializes in wiring harnesses, plastic components, and rearview mirrors for passenger cars, serving major global automakers like Volkswagen, Ford, and Toyota. The company has shown strong financial growth, with FY 2023-24 revenues of approximately ₹18,500 crore (about $2.3 billion) and a net profit around ₹1,500 crore, supported by extensive R&D investments. Samvardhana Motherson aims to be a global leader with a focus on innovation, sustainability, and a customer-centric approach, targeting revenues of ₹25,000 crore by 2024. It has expanded globally via acquisitions, including German and Japanese companies, strengthening its position in advanced automotive electrical and interior components.

Muthoot Finance Limited is India's largest gold loan non-banking financial company (NBFC), founded in 1939 and headquartered in Kochi, Kerala. In FY25, it achieved its highest-ever consolidated loan assets under management (AUM) of ₹1.22 trillion, a 37% year-over-year increase, with standalone gold loan AUM crossing ₹1.02 trillion. The company reported a consolidated profit after tax (PAT) of ₹5,352 crore, up 20% year-over-year. Muthoot Finance has diversified its portfolio to include affordable housing loans, microfinance, personal loans, and small business loans, alongside its core gold loan business. The company continues to focus on digital initiatives and an omnichannel strategy to enhance customer experience and expand its reach beyond traditional gold loans.

Nestlé India reported total sales of ₹5,100 crore in Q1 FY26, a 5.1% increase year-over-year.Net profit declined by 13.4% to ₹647 crore due to higher input costs and finance expenses.The Powdered and Liquid Beverages category was a strong growth driver with double-digit growth.The company saw expanded manufacturing capacity lead to elevated operational costs.Nestlé India remains one of the top FMCG companies in India, focusing on premiumization and innovation.

NTPC Limited, India's largest power generator, reported consolidated revenue of ₹47,821 crore for Q1 FY 2025-26, a decline of 2.4% year-over-year.The company posted a profit after tax (PAT) of ₹6,108 crore, an 11% increase compared to Q1 FY 2024-25. NTPC's coal power stations achieved a Plant Load Factor (PLF) of 75.16%, higher than the Rest of India Coal PLF of 67.67%. Standalone revenue was ₹43,333 crore with a PAT of ₹4,775 crore, marking a 6% increase year-over-year. NTPC is expanding renewable energy capacity alongside its coal-based generation and aims for sustainability and growth in the energy sector.

Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) reported a consolidated net profit of ₹11,554 crore for Q1 FY26, an 18.2% increase year-over-year. The consolidated revenue stood at ₹1,63,108 crore, down 3.5% from the previous year. Standalone revenue was ₹32,003 crore, a 9.3% decline, with standalone net profit falling 10.2% to ₹8,024 crore. Crude oil production rose by 1.2% to 4.683 million metric tonnes, while natural gas production was slightly lower at 4.846 billion cubic meters. ONGC benefited from a premium on new well gas revenue, receiving a 20% higher price than the domestic administered price, contributing ₹1,703 crore in Q1 FY26.

Ola Consumers, formerly known as Ola Cabs, is one of India's leading ride-hailing platforms founded in 2010 by Bhavish Aggarwal and Ankit Bhati. It serves around 150 million active users globally, offering multiple vehicle options including cabs, autos, and bikes across more than 250 cities in India. Ola has diversified into electric vehicles through Ola Electric and financial services with Ola Financial Services, alongside its food business powered by a large network of cloud kitchens. The company focuses on hyperlocal penetration, technology innovation, and driver partnerships to cater to the unique needs of diverse Indian markets. Despite valuation reductions amid tough competition, Ola turned EBITDA profitable in FY24 and is regrouping for sustainable growth under its new brand, Ola Consumer.

Ola Electric Mobility Limited reported consolidated revenues of ₹3,698 crore for the fiscal year ending March 2025, down from the previous year. The company continues to operate at a loss, with a net loss of ₹2,357 crore in FY25, worsened from ₹1,584 crore loss in FY24. Operating profit margin remained negative at -38%, reflecting ongoing investment in growth and expansion. Total assets stand at ₹11,075 crore, with equity share capital increased to ₹4,411 crore as part of expansion efforts.
