Despite financial losses, Ola Electric is focusing on scaling production, technology upgrades, and expanding its EV footprint in India.

Oracle Corporation reported fiscal year 2025 total revenues of $57.4 billion, up 8% year-over-year in USD and 9% in constant currency. Cloud services and license support revenues increased 12% to $44 billion, while cloud infrastructure consumption revenue grew 62% in Q4 FY25. Oracle's GAAP net income for FY25 was $12.4 billion, and non-GAAP net income was $17.3 billion. CEO Safra Catz projects even higher growth in FY26, with cloud revenue growth expected to surpass 40% and cloud infrastructure growth over 70%. Oracle is expanding its multicloud datacenter footprint aggressively, with over 23 datacenters live and plans for 47 more, driving strong multi-cloud revenue growth.

Oriental Bank of Commerce (OBC) was a government-owned bank established in 1943 and nationalized in 1980. It underwent several mergers, including with Bari Doab Bank and Punjab Cooperative Bank in 1997, and Global Trust Bank in 2004. On April 1, 2020, OBC merged with Punjab National Bank (PNB) along with United Bank of India, creating the second largest public sector bank in India by business and branch network. Post-merger, all OBC branches started functioning as PNB branches, expanding PNB’s footprint to over 11,000 branches and 13,000 ATMs nationwide. The merger aimed to create a globally competitive, next-generation bank, branded as PNB 2.0, improving customer services and operational efficiency.

Pearl Global Industries Limited is India’s largest listed garment exporter with manufacturing operations across South Asia, Southeast Asia, and Central America. For Q1 FY26, the company reported consolidated revenue of ₹1,228 crore, up 16.6% year-over-year, driven by strong growth in Vietnam and Indonesia. Adjusted EBITDA for Q1 FY26 was ₹114 crore, a 13.4% increase year-over-year, with a margin of 9.3%. Pearl Global faces tariff challenges from the US on Indian exports and is shifting some production to more favorable countries like Vietnam, Indonesia, Bangladesh, and Guatemala. The company continues to focus on new markets like the UK, Japan, and Australia while increasing capital expenditure and expanding operations in Bangladesh.

Pfizer Inc. is an American multinational pharmaceutical and biotechnology company headquartered in New York City, founded in 1849. It develops and produces medications and vaccines across various fields including immunology, oncology, cardiology, and neurology. Some of its top products by revenue in 2024 include Eliquis, Prevnar, Paxlovid, and the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine. Pfizer is ranked among the largest biomedical companies globally and operates in over 125 countries. The company is committed to innovation and improving global health through scientific breakthroughs and accessible healthcare solutions .

Philips, officially Koninklijke Philips N.V., is a Dutch multinational health technology company founded in 1891 and headquartered in Amsterdam. It focuses on healthcare innovation, offering products in three core segments: Diagnosis & Treatment, Connected Care, and Personal Health. Philips reported a 2024 revenue of €18.02 billion with a net income of €698 million, employing around 68,000 people globally. The company is known for its medical imaging, patient monitoring, and personal wellness products. Philips aims to improve health and well-being globally, targeting to impact 2.5 billion lives annually by 2030 through meaningful innovation and sustainability efforts .

Piramal Enterprises Limited is an Indian diversified non-banking financial company (NBFC) and part of the Piramal Group. It operates across retail and wholesale lending, fund-based platforms, and investments, managing assets worth about $10 billion with a network spanning over 400 branches across India. The company focuses on retail lending, housing finance, vehicle financing, and corporate lending, and has multiple partnerships in the fintech space. In 2025, Piramal Enterprises merged with its subsidiary Piramal Finance and became one of the top private sector NBFCs in India. Apart from financial services, it has history in pharmaceuticals and real estate, evolving to focus on financial services and alternative asset management .

Porter is one of India's largest logistics marketplaces, founded in 2014 and headquartered in Mumbai. It specializes in intra-city and inter-city logistics, providing on-demand transportation solutions including trucks, two-wheelers, and enterprise logistics services. Porter serves over 5 million customers across more than 20 cities and engages around 300,000 gig workers monthly. The company is known for its asset-light model, operational efficiency, and strong backing from investors like Mahindra and Sequoia Capital. In 2025, Porter became a unicorn with a valuation over $1 billion, aiming to expand its tech platform and gig worker infrastructure while empowering its driver-partners with better earnings and independence .

Power Finance Corporation Ltd. (PFC) is India's largest Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC) focused on financing the power sector. Established in 1986 and under the Ministry of Power, Government of India, PFC plays a pivotal role in funding power generation, transmission, and distribution projects nationwide. It holds the status of a 'Maharatna' CPSE, granting it greater financial and operational autonomy. As of 2025, PFC has a loan asset book of over Rs. 5.43 lakh crore with a strong focus on clean energy, including the largest renewable energy loan portfolio in India. The Government of India holds a 56% stake in PFC, which reported its highest-ever annual profit in FY 2024-25, showcasing robust growth and leadership in the power finance sector .

Power Grid Corporation of India Limited (POWERGRID) is India's largest electric power transmission company, operating over 1,80,000 circuit kilometers of transmission lines and around 286 substations as of 2025. Headquartered in Gurugram, it is a Maharatna Central Public Sector Enterprise under the Ministry of Power, Government of India, with a 51.34% government stake. POWERGRID manages the planning, implementation, operation, and maintenance of the country's inter-state transmission system, facilitating the transfer of bulk power efficiently across India. The company is committed to becoming a net zero emissions organization by 2047 and aims for 50% electricity consumption from renewable sources by 2025. In FY 2023-24, it reported revenues exceeding ₹32,000 crore and a net profit margin of 27%, highlighting its financial strength and leadership in power transmission .

Power Mech Projects Limited, founded in 1999 and based in Hyderabad, India, is a leading engineering and construction company specializing in the erection, testing, and commissioning (ETC) of large power plants. The company offers comprehensive services including installation of critical equipment like boilers, turbines, and generators, as well as infrastructure development such as civil works and water treatment systems through its Balance of Plant (BOP) division. Power Mech is the largest operation and maintenance (O&M) service provider in India’s power sector and has expanded its service portfolio into non-power sectors like railways, water projects, mining, and infrastructure. It has a strong pan-India presence with international operations in regions including the Middle East and Africa. The company is known for its integrated service model, proven execution track record, and strategic growth with a focus on sustainable revenue and asset management .

Praj Industries Limited is an Indian multinational biotechnology and engineering company headquartered in Pune, Maharashtra, with offices worldwide. Founded in 1983, it provides sustainable solutions in bioenergy, high purity water systems, critical process equipment, breweries, and wastewater treatment plants. The company is a global leader in biofuel technology, particularly ethanol plants, and offers integrated engineering solutions from design to commissioning. Praj has world-class manufacturing facilities in India accredited with international certifications like ISO and ASME. It focuses on innovation in renewable fuels, biopharmaceuticals, and environmental sustainability, employing around 1,200 professionals globally .

Precision Wires India Limited (PWIL), founded in 1989 and headquartered in Mumbai, is the largest manufacturer of copper winding wires, also known as magnet wires, in South Asia. The company produces a range of products including enameled round and rectangular copper wires, continuously transposed conductors (CTC), and paper-mica-nomex insulated copper conductors (PICC) used extensively in electrical and electronic industries worldwide. PWIL is known for high quality and innovation, adhering to international standards like ISO and IEC, with advanced manufacturing and rigorous testing processes. The company has a production capacity of about 48,000 metric tons annually and exports to over 40 countries. PWIL also focuses on sustainability and eco-friendly manufacturing to reduce environmental impact .

Prince Pipes and Fittings Limited (PPFL), established in 1987, is one of India's largest manufacturers of PVC and multi-polymer piping solutions. The company specializes in plumbing, sewerage, and drainage piping systems catering to both residential and commercial applications. It manufactures pipes using CPVC, UPVC, HDPE, and PPR polymers and continues expanding its production capacity, including a large new plant in Bihar. Despite recent demand challenges and inventory corrections, Prince Pipes aims for double-digit volume growth and margin normalization in the coming years. The company has a market capitalization of around ₹3,574 crore and is recognized for innovation and leadership in the Indian piping industry .

company_name: Procter & Gamble Hygiene and Health Care
company_description: Procter & Gamble Hygiene and Health Care Limited (P&G Health India) is one of India's largest companies in the Vitamins, Minerals, and Supplements (VMS) sector, manufacturing and marketing over-the-counter health products. Originally set up in India in 1967 as a subsidiary of Merck, it became part of P&G after acquiring Merck’s Consumer Health business in 2018. The company operates a large manufacturing facility in Goa, which is GMP-certified and exports products to 13 countries. P&G Health India focuses on trusted brands supported by science and trusted by doctors, pharmacists, and consumers, aiming to improve health and quality of life. It is a key player in India’s healthcare market, combining global P&G expertise with legacy Merck capabilities .

Rajesh Exports Limited, founded in 1989 and headquartered in Bangalore, India, is the world's largest integrated gold processing and jewelry manufacturing company. It operates across the entire value chain of gold, from refining to retailing, processing around 35% of the world's gold production. The company owns advanced manufacturing and R&D facilities in Bangalore, India, and a state-of-the-art refining unit in Balerna, Switzerland. Rajesh Exports is also known for its extensive and exclusive jewelry design database and is the lowest-cost gold jewelry producer globally. The company markets its products through its retail brand 'Shubh Jewellers' and exports to many international markets, making it a global leader in the gold business .

Ramkrishna Forgings Limited (RKFL), established in 1981 and headquartered in Kolkata, is India's second-largest forging company with an installed capacity of around 210,900 tonnes per annum. The company manufactures forged components for various sectors including automotive, railways, farm equipment, earthmoving, mining, construction, oil & gas, power, and general engineering. RKFL serves customers in over 22 countries, with a strong presence in North America and Europe, offering more than 2,000 products. Its growth strategy includes acquisitions, market expansion, and diversification into passenger vehicle and railway segments, supported by significant contracts such as a ₹12,227 crore railway contract for forged wheels. In FY 2024, RKFL reported revenues of ₹3,489.61 crore and profits of ₹326.07 crore, positioning itself as a key player in the Make in India initiative and automotive manufacturing sector .

Rapido is an Indian ride-hailing company, primarily known as the largest bike taxi aggregator in the country. Founded in 2015 and headquartered in Bengaluru, it provides bike taxi services along with app-based auto rickshaw and taxicab hailing, parcel delivery, and third-party logistics services. Rapido operates in over 150 cities across India, serving millions of rides with a strong emphasis on safety, affordability, and convenience. The company became a unicorn in 2024 with a valuation of $1.1 billion and continues to expand its offerings and geographic presence. Rapido has received significant funding from investors like Swiggy, TVS Motor Company, and Prosus .

Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) is India’s largest private-sector conglomerate, headquartered in Mumbai, with diversified business operations including refining and petrochemicals, oil and gas exploration, telecommunications, retail, and new energy materials. As of FY25, RIL reported consolidated gross revenue of ₹1,071,174 crore with a profit after tax of ₹81,309 crore, showcasing strong growth across its major segments. The company operates the world’s largest refining complex in Jamnagar and leads in digital services through Jio Platforms, which boasts over 500 million subscribers. Reliance Retail is India's largest retailer, operating more than 19,000 stores with 349 million registered customers. The company is also investing heavily in new energy including solar, green hydrogen, and carbon fiber, aiming to create a fully integrated renewable energy ecosystem, positioning itself as a key player in India’s energy transition .

Shriram Pistons & Rings Limited (SPRL) is India's largest manufacturer of pistons, piston pins, piston rings, and engine valves, with over 50 years of experience in the automotive components industry. Founded in 1963 and headquartered in New Delhi, the company serves leading OEMs in India and globally, including in Europe, the USA, and Asia, for passenger and commercial vehicles, two- and three-wheelers, tractors, and off-highway vehicles. SPRL operates advanced manufacturing plants in Ghaziabad, Pathredi, and Pithampur, supplemented by a strong R&D center with skilled engineering talent. The company has technical collaborations with global leaders from Germany and Japan, producing products meeting stringent emission and performance norms. It is recognized for quality and innovation, holding multiple awards, and is India's largest exporter of pistons and rings, with a market cap exceeding $1 billion as of 2024 .

Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited (STFC) is one of India’s leading non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) specializing in commercial vehicle financing. It is part of the Shriram Group, a prominent financial conglomerate with over 50 years of experience. In November 2022, STFC merged with Shriram City Union Finance and Shriram Capital to form Shriram Finance Limited, creating one of the largest retail NBFCs in India. As of mid-2025, Shriram Finance operates over 3,200 branches with a workforce of nearly 80,000 and manages assets worth approximately ₹2.72 lakh crore. The company offers a broad product portfolio covering commercial vehicle loans, passenger vehicle loans, construction equipment loans, personal loans, gold loans, and MSME financing, with a strong focus on serving both rural and urban customers .

Sona BLW Precision Forgings Limited, also known as Sona Comstar, is a leading Indian automotive technology company specializing in the design, manufacture, and supply of highly engineered automotive systems and components. Established in 1995 and headquartered in India, Sona Comstar focuses on differential gears, driveline components, electric vehicle (EV) components, and precision forged gears. The company operates 10 manufacturing plants across India, the USA, Mexico, and China, and has multiple state-of-the-art R&D centers. Its product portfolio includes inter-axle differential assemblies, bevel gears, e-axles, e-transmissions, motors, and various types of differential assemblies, serving global automotive OEMs across the US, Europe, India, and China. Sona Comstar is notable for its innovation in EV technology and has grown through strategic acquisitions and joint ventures, positioning itself as a key player in the global automotive supply chain .

State Bank of India (SBI) is India's largest multinational public sector bank and financial services entity, headquartered in Mumbai. It commands a significant market share with over 23% of India’s banking assets and serves more than 500 million customers. Founded originally as the Bank of Calcutta in 1806 and transformed into SBI in 1955, it has over 22,500 branches and a wide international presence across 29 countries with 241 offices. SBI is recognized as a domestic systemically important bank (D-SIB) and was ranked 178th in the Fortune Global 500 list in 2024. The bank reported a consolidated revenue of ₹498,424 crore and a net profit of ₹82,550 crore in 2025, underlining its critical role in India’s banking sector and economy .

Sumitomo Chemical India Limited (SCIL) is a subsidiary of Sumitomo Chemical Company Limited, Japan, and operates as a leading player in India's agrochemical, biopesticides, feed additives, household insecticides, and animal nutrition sectors. Established in April 2000 and headquartered in Mumbai, SCIL offers a broad portfolio of crop protection products, plant growth regulators, and precision farming solutions aimed at enhancing agricultural productivity sustainably. The company completed a merger with Excel Crop Care Limited in 2019, strengthening its market position as the second-largest agrichemical company in India. SCIL has multiple manufacturing plants across India, including locations in Vapi, Tarapur, Bhavnagar, Silvassa, and Gajod, and focuses strongly on innovation, quality, research & development, and social upliftment of farmers through its business activities .

Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Limited (Sun Pharma), founded in 1983 and headquartered in Mumbai, is the largest pharmaceutical company in India and the fourth largest specialty generic pharmaceutical company globally. It operates in over 100 countries, with around 70% of its revenue coming from international markets, chiefly the US and India. Sun Pharma's product portfolio spans chronic and acute therapies across numerous therapeutic segments such as psychiatry, cardiology, oncology, dermatology, and more, supported by 43 manufacturing sites worldwide. The company is known for its strong focus on innovation, investing 6-8% of its global revenues annually in research and development to develop complex generics, novel drug delivery systems, and specialty therapies. Sun Pharma has grown through strategic acquisitions, including Ranbaxy Laboratories and Taro Pharmaceuticals, and has a workforce of over 43,000 employees globally. It maintains a strong presence in key global markets with a commitment to improving access to quality medicines .

Swiggy Limited, founded in 2014 and headquartered in Bengaluru, is India’s leading online food and grocery delivery platform. It operates in over 600 cities across India, connecting millions of customers with restaurants, grocery stores, and service providers. Swiggy offers multiple services including food delivery, Swiggy Instamart for quick grocery and essentials delivery, Swiggy Genie for on-demand pick-up and drop, and Swiggy Dineout for restaurant reservations. The company emphasizes technology-driven logistics and AI to provide fast, efficient delivery experiences. Swiggy also offers a subscription service called Swiggy One, which provides benefits across food, grocery, and delivery. The company went public via an IPO in November 2024, and its mission is to elevate the quality of life for urban consumers by offering unparalleled convenience .

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), founded in 1968 as Tata Computer Systems, is a flagship company of the Tata Group and a global leader in IT services, consulting, and business solutions. Headquartered in Mumbai, India, TCS operates in 150 locations across 46 countries. It pioneered offshore software services from India and has grown to become one of the world's largest IT services firms, with a market capitalization exceeding ₹11 trillion as of 2025. TCS serves multiple industries including banking, finance, insurance, telecom, manufacturing, and retail, and is known for its innovation, engineering excellence, and customer service. It was the first Indian IT company to reach $1 billion revenue in 2003 and went public in 2004. Today, it continues to lead with offerings in digital transformation, cloud, AI, and enterprise solutions, employing hundreds of thousands globally .

Tata Elxsi Limited, founded in 1989 and headquartered in Bangalore, India, is a leading global provider of design and technology services across multiple industries including automotive, broadcast, communications, healthcare, and transportation. The company specializes in software development, system integration, and support, offering end-to-end solutions from concept to market launch. Tata Elxsi is known for its design-led, AI-first approach, leveraging technologies like IoT, cloud computing, virtual reality, and artificial intelligence to help clients innovate and transform their products and services. Its offerings span automotive engineering, digital therapeutics, regulatory guidance, and digital transformation services, with a significant focus on software-defined platforms and electrification in transportation. Tata Elxsi operates in 16 countries with over 13,000 employees, emphasizing sustainability and ESG principles in its corporate strategy .

Tata Motors, founded in 1945 and part of the Tata Group, is India’s largest automobile manufacturer and a global player producing cars, trucks, buses, and defense vehicles. It holds a strong market position in commercial vehicles and ranks among the top three in passenger vehicles in India. The company has a global footprint with production units and R&D centers in India, the UK, South Korea, and more. Tata Motors acquired Jaguar Land Rover in 2008, expanding its luxury vehicle portfolio. The company is also advancing in electric and hydrogen vehicle technologies as part of its commitment to sustainable mobility .

Tata Power, founded in 1910 and headquartered in Mumbai, is India’s largest integrated power company with a total installed capacity of over 15.5 GW, including 43% from renewable sources. The company is aggressively transitioning to green energy, targeting 70% renewable capacity by 2030 with significant investments in solar, wind, hydro, and hybrid energy projects. Tata Power operates across power generation, transmission, and distribution, serving more than 1.25 crore customers, and plans to expand its consumer base to 4 crores by 2030. It has launched advanced digital platforms for Energy as a Service (EaaS) and is investing in EV charging infrastructure and green hydrogen. The company reported a net profit of ₹4,200 crore in FY24 and plans a capital expenditure of ₹25,000 crore for FY26, focusing on clean energy growth .

Tata Steel, established in 1907 by Jamsetji Tata, is one of India's oldest and largest steel producers with its main plant located in Jamshedpur. It operates globally with a crude steel capacity of over 21 million tonnes per annum, including significant operations in Europe after acquiring Corus in 2007. The company produces a wide range of steel products for industries such as automotive, construction, packaging, and infrastructure. Tata Steel is known for pioneering industrial and scientific approaches in India’s steel sector and is committed to sustainability and innovation. It reported a turnover of INR 1,40,987 crore in FY24 and continues to invest in expansion and advanced high-strength steel technologies .

Tech Mahindra, established in 1986, is a leading global IT services and consulting company headquartered in Pune, India. It operates in over 90 countries, delivering a wide range of services including digital transformation, consulting, cloud, AI, and IoT solutions. The company is part of the Mahindra Group and serves diverse industries like telecommunications, healthcare, finance, and automotive. In 2025, Tech Mahindra earned top sustainability ratings and showcased strong financial growth with significant investments in product and platform development. It continues to focus on innovation, client success, and expanding its global footprint .

Titan Company Limited, established in 1984 as a joint venture between Tata Group and TIDCO, is a leading Indian lifestyle company known for watches, jewelry, eyewear, and accessories. It owns prominent brands like Titan Watches, Tanishq (jewelry), Fastrack (fashion accessories), and Titan Eyeplus (eyewear). Titan is India’s largest branded jewelry maker by value and the fifth-largest watch manufacturer globally. The company reported strong revenue growth with ₹40,883 crore in FY23 and continues expanding internationally, including new stores in Dubai, Singapore, and the US. It focuses on innovation, sustainability, and expanding product offerings in fashion, fragrances, and smart wearables .

TVS Motor Company, founded in 1978 and part of the TVS Group, is one of India's leading manufacturers of two-wheelers and three-wheelers. The company started as a joint venture with Suzuki but became independent in 2001, focusing on innovation and expanding its product portfolio. It is the fourth-largest two-wheeler manufacturer globally, producing popular models like the Apache series, Ntorq scooter, and iQube electric scooter. TVS has manufacturing plants in India and international operations, emphasizing sustainability and cutting-edge technology. Its strong legacy is built on trust, value, and service, continuing to drive growth in the evolving automotive market .

Uber Technologies, Inc. is a leading American multinational company offering ride-hailing, food delivery, freight transport, and courier services globally. Headquartered in San Francisco, it operates in about 70 countries and 15,000 cities, serving over 180 million active users monthly. In 2024, Uber reported revenues of $43.9 billion and reached its first operating profit in 2023. The company is advancing autonomous vehicle technology and robotaxi services through partnerships with Lucid Motors and Baidu. Uber is also committed to achieving a fully electric, zero-emission platform by 2040 .

UltraTech Cement Limited, the cement flagship company of the Aditya Birla Group, is India's largest manufacturer of grey cement, ready-mix concrete (RMC), and white cement. It is the third largest cement producer globally outside China, with a consolidated production capacity exceeding 190 million tonnes per annum. UltraTech operates 24 integrated manufacturing units, 33 grinding units, and over 300 RMC plants across India and international markets including UAE, Bahrain, Sri Lanka, and Bangladesh. The company is committed to sustainability and innovation, being a founding member of the Global Cement and Concrete Association and actively working on decarbonization initiatives. UltraTech has a widespread distribution network covering over 80% of the Indian market and continues to invest significantly in capacity expansion and green technologies .

Vedanta Limited is a leading global natural resources conglomerate headquartered in Mumbai, India, with diversified operations in aluminium, zinc-lead-silver, oil and gas, iron ore, steel, copper, power, ferro alloys, nickel, semiconductors, and glass. The company is one of India's largest producers of base metals and oil, with a significant presence across India, South Africa, Namibia, and Liberia. Vedanta is focused on sustainable development and innovation, committing $5 billion over the next decade toward achieving net-zero carbon emissions. It recently reported strong financial performance with a FY25 revenue of ₹1,52,968 crore and net profit growth driven by aluminium and zinc production efficiency. Vedanta also aims to expand in semiconductors and technology sectors, positioning itself as a key player in India's industrial growth and energy transition .

WABCO India, now part of ZF Commercial Vehicle Solutions since 2020, is a leading supplier of advanced braking and control systems for commercial vehicles in India. It holds a market share of over 85% in the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) segment. The company has manufacturing units in Chennai and Jamshedpur and focuses heavily on innovation and software development to enhance vehicle safety and efficiency. WABCO India reports strong financial performance with zero debt and a net profit margin above 12% as of FY25. It continues to expand its product portfolio and export capabilities, serving global markets from India .

Wipro Limited, headquartered in Bengaluru, is a leading global IT services, consulting, and business process services company. It provides extensive technology solutions including cloud computing, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, and digital transformation to diverse industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing. In 2025, Wipro reported a gross revenue of ₹221.3 billion and is advancing AI-powered solutions to enhance client operations. The company focuses on innovation through its strategic investments in startups and expanding cloud and engineering services globally. Wipro remains a pillar in India’s IT sector with operations spanning 17 countries and support in 10 languages .

Yes Bank is a leading Indian private sector bank headquartered in Mumbai, established in 2003. It serves retail customers, MSMEs, and corporate clients with a wide range of financial services including banking, wealth management, and fintech solutions. The bank operates over 1,200 branches and processes one in three UPI transactions nationally, reflecting its extensive presence across India. Yes Bank is known for its customer-centric approach, transparency, and innovative digital banking capabilities. It focuses on sustainable growth, strong governance, and building long-term relationships with customers and stakeholders .

Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL), established in 1992 and headquartered in Mumbai, is a leading Indian media and entertainment company. It operates a diverse portfolio of over 45 domestic and international television channels across genres like general entertainment, movies, music, and regional languages. ZEEL owns a vast content library with over 260,000 hours of television content and rights to about 4,800 movie titles. The company also runs the popular OTT platform ZEE5, which has a global subscriber base exceeding 100 million users. ZEEL is known for its strong presence in broadcasting, digital media, movies, music, and live entertainment, serving audiences in over 190 countries with revenues exceeding ₹18,000 crore (approximately US$2.17 billion) as of 3Q FY25 .

Zepto is an Indian quick-commerce company founded in 2021 by Aadit Palicha and Kaivalya Vohra, headquartered in Bengaluru. It specializes in delivering groceries, fresh produce, and daily essentials within 10 minutes using a network of over 250 dark stores across more than 50 cities in India. Zepto has rapidly scaled with strong technology and an optimized delivery model, offering more than 45,000 products including groceries, electronics, and beauty items. The company has raised significant funding, with valuations reaching $5 billion in 2024, marking it as one of India's fastest-growing startups. Zepto also runs a cafe division and has a paid membership program with millions of subscribers .

Zoho Corporation is an Indian multinational technology company founded in 1996 by Sridhar Vembu and Tony Thomas. Originally named AdventNet, Inc., it started with network management software and later rebranded to Zoho Corporation in 2009 after launching its online office suite. Headquartered in Chennai, India, with additional offices including a major hub near Austin, Texas, Zoho offers a comprehensive suite of cloud-based business software applications like Zoho CRM, Zoho Books, and Zoho One. The company serves over 80 million users worldwide, including many Fortune 500 companies, and remains privately owned, emphasizing innovation and sustainability. Zoho is recognized for its integrated applications that support business operations across various sectors globally .

Zomato is an Indian food-tech company founded in 2008 by Deepinder Goyal and Pankaj Chaddah, initially named 'Foodiebay.' It started as an online restaurant discovery platform providing menus, reviews, and ratings. Over time, Zomato expanded internationally and diversified into food delivery, acquiring Uber Eats India in 2020 to consolidate its market position. It introduced services like table reservations, subscription programs (Zomato Pro), and grocery deliveries, successfully going public with an IPO in 2021. Headquartered in Gurgaon, Zomato is now a major player in food delivery and restaurant discovery, operating in multiple countries with a valuation exceeding $13 billion .
